agenda.description: ** REVISION ** HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Transportation TIME & DATE: 2:00 PM or upon final adjourn./recess or bill referral if permission granted Wednesday, April 24, 2019 PLACE: E2.030 CHAIR: Rep. Terry Canales *Public testimony may be limited to two (2) minutes.* If submitting written documentation, please provide 15 copies (with your name on each) to the committee clerk before or during the hearing. The order in which bills are heard is at the discretion of the Chair. If you intend to testify, please register using the electronic witness affirmation form, which will be available at any registration kiosk located throughout the Capitol Extension. Witness registration will open approximately two (2) hours prior to the start of the hearing and must be completed prior to testifying. HB 3068 Kuempel Relating to the use of certain license plates on classic motor vehicles and travel trailers, custom vehicles, street rods, and certain exhibition vehicles. HB 3089 Martinez Relating to payment of costs related to the relocation of certain political subdivision utility facilities for state highway projects. HB 3446 Guillen Relating to the enforcement of commercial vehicle safety standards in certain counties. HB 4024 Romero, Jr. Relating to a prohibition on certain contracts with certain agents of foreign entities. HB 4053 Kacal Relating to the authorization of the construction of an electric railway on or across a road, street, alley, square, or property of a county or municipality. HB 4427 Canales Relating to the authority of the Texas Department of Transportation to extend the term of a comprehensive development agreement for a portion of State Highway 130. SB 198 Schwertner | et al. Relating to payment for the use of a highway toll project. Notice of this meeting was announced from the house floor. Bills added after last posting: HB 4427 ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions ** of the schedule, if applicable. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
